guide.title: Heartbeat 2.x to Heartbeat 3.x with Pacemaker upgrade guide
guide.abstract: This guide describes how to migrate from Heartbeat-2.x to 3.x on your Gentoo machine.

body.warn: This document is not intended to be a tutorial on howto create ha-cluster using heartbeat. It serves as a supplement to recent >=sys-cluster/heartbeat-3.0 unmasking.
body.note: For a complete HA-Cluster HOWTO point your browser to http://www.linux-ha.org/doc/users-guide/users-guide.html
body.p: Please be aware that new Pacemaker also supports OpenAIS/Corosync cluster infrastructure besides Heartbeat, and the former is being preferred solution by the upstream.
Shutdown one of your nodes. This keeps the cluster working while we prepare the migration.

Heartbeat-2.x was using the user cluster and group cluster for its file permissions. Cluster-glue/Pacemaker now uses the user hacluster and group haclient, so we'll have to migrate them to ensure the owner user/group on the used directories remain correct.
Adjust the permissions/rights of the folders used by heartbeat.
body.pre: # chown -R hacluster:haclient /var/lib/pengine # chown -R hacluster:haclient /var/lib/heartbeat/* # chown -R hacluster:haclient /var/run/crm
body.note: You may not have all of those folders, as their existence depends on your USE flags and version of heartbeat.

body.p: Export your current haresource file to a CIB formatted xml.
Now there are two possibilities depending on whether or not you were running heartbeat-2.x with crm. Check crm on/off in /etc/ha.d/ha.cf.
Now, import your resources from previously exported CIB.
Use import.xml as the actual CIB of heartbeat-3.x.
Thanks Norman Shulman for testing the procedure described in this document.
